pageContext.claim: “Trump 52% approval jolts Washington best in years.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump cited a daily tracking poll by Rasmussen, which consistently has a Republican-leaning bias; it fell to 50 percent the next day. The polling gurus at FiveThirtyEight say that an adjusted rating would have shown Trump at 45 percent in the poll. On the day of the tweet, Trump had an average approval of 40.4 percent in 538's blended poll rating, along with 55.1 percent disapproval.
